column2: oldfogy38, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: My bone loss was minimal while on Miacalcin, since the insurance company increased the price beyond my ability to pay, the bone loss has been dramatic.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this treatment is awsome.  I love drugs.

Have been using only the spray for 4 years due to osteoperosis.  Bone mass has increased, but only slightly in spine and a little more in hip. During last year of use,  experienced runny nose very often and finally, a red circle formed on the top of nose (size of a quarter)and was very red.  Runny nose and redness has decreased since discontinuing the spray six weeks ago, but not completely.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Easy to use, I place the bottle on the side of the medicine cabinet related to the side of the nasal passage I used. This way I know to insert it in the other passage the next day. My only concern is I have noticed some hair loss and don't know if its related to this med?

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Miacalcin improved the results on my spine  and has kept my readings from my hip bone stable since I started using it about 3 years ago.

column2: OneDaughter, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: My Mother had abdomanal radiation which caused her pelvis to have multiple fractures which caused excurtiating pain.  The orthopedic Doctor put her on this for bone pain and within two days the bone pain was gone.  He said he did not know why Miacalcin worked for the pain but it had worked for other patients and it worked for my Mom.  It increased her a quality of life which was such a great blessing!  I'm trying to tell everyone I know since it doesn't seem to be a very well known use for the drug.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: It was so easy to take without any side effects...but after a year my bone density test did not change!

column2: Janet, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: It seemed to be no problem to use it for a year or so, but now when I use it, I begin sneezing over and over and have had to quit using it.  Also had unexplained back pain (on one side) which has disappeared since I quite using Miacalcin.  However, my bone density did improve using it with Evista so I'm not happy not being able to use it.  There is also a generic Fortical.

column2: Maggie, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: So far so good. It is easy to use and no problems.  Will know more after my next bone scan.

column2: Hairiette, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: My bone density increased while using this medication. I have had many stomach issues with other types of treatment. I've been using it for a couple of years.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Miacalcin for over two years.  While Miacalcin is very easy to use, it is slow acting.  My bone density test showed that I lost bone mass.  Now, I take it along with Boniva.  Hope the combo helps.

column2: Pam, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This is easy to use and I hope it works.
